basics.name: Natnael Getahun
basics.label: Security Consultant
basics.summary: Welcome to my resume! My name is Nati, I am an MIT '15 and security professional. My primary interests revolve around web application security, security policy and better understanding how individuals can write secure code. For the last two years I have worked in a security pentesting role and had the pleasure of seeing a wide range of technologies and garner a better understanding of the security landscape of the web.

work.summary: Developed tools, managed incident response and identified vulnerabilities for the product security team.
highlights: Designed and developed internal applications to automate away security related concerns.
Provided security reviews of applications in Golang, Python and Java and offered context specific recommendations to remedy potential threats.
Provided security reviews of new architecture and infrastructure in both AWS and GCP
Developed product security monitoring tools to automate the identification of critical components in a constantly evolving and large organization without blocking developers.
Facilitated product incidence response, quickly identifying solutions and delegating efforts.

work.summary: Performed dozens of security assessments of a wide range of platforms of various size and complexity.
highlights: Identified critical vulnerabilities in Web Applications (Rails, Spring, Django, etc), iOS and Android applications, REST and SOAP APIs, internal and external networks, Linux Host Configurations and SSO deployments
Triaged Bug Bounty issues and acted as liason between companies and pentesters
Managed and mentored an intern through a summer research project
Tech lead complex projects solo and as part of a group
Wrote internal Python tools to simplify day to day testing

work.summary: Provided programming support for a research project that attempted to get a better understanding of the Zero Day market and bug bounties.
highlights: Wrote Python scripts to scrape Hackerone and organize data about public bug bounties and their payouts

work.summary: Provided programming support for a research project that attempted to optimize the optimization layer of SMT solvers using Program Synthesis and Machine Learning.
highlights: Wrote an SMTlibv2 parser in Python and translated it into a Directed Acyclic Graph that can be consumed by Sketch

work.summary: Performed security assessments, improved automated phishing detection software and developed new APIs to interact with Namecheap.
Researched security vulnerabilities in application control software and their impact on Lumension's software.
highlights: Wrote a comprehensive Metasploit tutorial for use by sales engineers in the field
Developed stress testing tools that functioned at the Windows System Call level

work.summary: Taught incoming and current freshman multi-variable calculus through recitations. Additionally, I graded assignments and tests and held weekly office hours.
Wrote about my experiences at MIT to a large audience of potential incoming freshman.
